ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a lot of confidence in my Portuguese speaking skills, and learned a lot about Brazilian culture and the Portuguese language.

Through taking this course, I was able to broaden my Portuguese skills and gain a deeper understanding of Brazilian culture through arts. I appreciated the opportunity to practice reading and listening in Portuguese, as well as the chance to engage with classmates and professor. I can say that I definitely improved my speaking skills, including pronunciation and enunciation. Studying different forms of Brazilian art, including music, dance, literature, and visual art, helped me appreciate the beauty and complexity of Brazilian culture.
Advanced my portuguese language knowledge and learned a lot about Brazilian culture
I learned so much more about Brazilian culture, literature, film, and music. The cultural immersion aspect of this course was amazing. I especially loved reading O Peso do Pssaro Morto!
Learned/improved my speaking and trading abilities in Portuguese and was deeply immersed in the culture.
PORT140 supplemented an established foundation of grammar review, conversation, cultural topics, and readings from Brazilian literature.
The course offered me the opportunity to continue developing my understanding of Portuguese through analyses and personal endeavors into the arts.
I learned a lot about Brazilian art and expanded my Portuguese vocabulary. I feel like I got the chance to immerse myself in Brazilian art and culture.
I developed far more confidence in spoken Portuguese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: really welcoming enviornment!

One of the strengths of the course was having a Fullbright scholar as a professor who was from Rio de Janeiro. This definitely gave me a unique opportunity to learn from someone who had firsthand experiences of growing up in Brazil and was able to offer insights into the culture and society that I would not have otherwise had access to.
Strengths: brazil, Thais is a very good and laidback prof + very understanding

The strengths are the incredible course material (books, films, music, etc), the fun games we have for #sextou, and above all, the incredible instructor. Thais is the reason why we all enjoyed this course so much. There are no weaknesses.

Strengths: interactive, engaging, close learning community
Weaknesses: class period is short, department did not provide adequate funding for opportunities

Strengths - Enjoyable projects, encouraged conversation, enjoyable content. 

Weaknesses - Could be a bit more intentful of making the best use of in-class time, though this is only a slight point.

Strengths - the assignments were always manageable, the course content was interesting, we got to explore multiple mediums of Brazilian art, the asynch day allowed us to do independent learning and return to group learning on Thursday and Friday. Weaknesses - the only weakness I can think of is that there could've been more lessons dealing with grammar, but I think grammar is generally something less focused on after L2 Portuguese.
More time devoted to grammar, particularly past tense, would have been very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! The content is engaging and the opportunity to learn in a small group setting is invaluable!
Absolutely! It brought me a lot of knowledge, experiences, and happiness!
portuguese is the best language at Yale
I absolutely recommend continuing your journey in studying Portuguese! The instructors are phenomenal and the content is genuinely interesting.
Yes, definitely! Chill and you learn a lot and meet lots of cool people.

I would recommend this course to any student wanting to expand on their language acquisition abilities, though make sure the professor teaching the course is in alignment with your learning needs. Thais was amazing!
I would definitely. I think it helps students in L3 advance their Portuguese even more.
I would definitely recommend it, although my immensely positive experience was heavily contingent on my teacher, Thais Vianna.
